revised_title: Thermal Neutron Diffusion Length in Water: Temperature and Poison Concentration Effects
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the diffusion length of thermal neutrons in water at various temperatures and with different concentrations of boric acid and cadmium sulfate. They found that the diffusion length decreases with increasing temperature and that the presence of neutron absorbers affects the diffusion process. The results provide valuable data for understanding and improving water-moderated power reactors.
